Train the model from a given engine

Source: R/train.R
train.Rd

Train a distribution() model with the specified engine.

train(
  x,
  runname,
  rm_corPred = FALSE,
  varsel = FALSE,
  inference_only = FALSE,
  only_linear = TRUE,
  bias_variable = NULL,
  bias_value = NULL,
  verbose = FALSE,
  ...
)

# S4 method for BiodiversityDistribution
train(x)

Arguments

x

distribution() (i.e. BiodiversityDistribution) object).
runname

A character name of the trained run
rm_corPred

Remove highly correlated predictors. Default is True
varsel

Perform a variable selection on the set of predictors
inference_only

Fit model only without spatial projection (Default: FALSE)
only_linear

Fit model only on linear covariate baselearners (DEFAULT: TRUE)
bias_variable

A vector with names of variables to be set to bias_value (Default: NULL)
bias_value

A vector with values to be set to bias_variable (Default: NULL)
...

further arguments passed on.

Value

A distribution prediction object

Details
